posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content:
I've made several attempts to build a toon that has many of characteristics related to Master Yoda of Star Wars fame - small, green, wicked with a blade, incredible discipline/mind strength.  I'm not great at ordering feats, etc., so I'd like to get the guild's perspectives on building him.  Primarily for roleplay, but not averse to seeing a powergame version.

PvM or PvP

Level cap - 40, playable all the way up

Race preference - he's Yoda, so Halfling or Gnome (I've never played either)

Class preference - gotta have at least 20 lvls of Monk (immune to mind-affecting).  The rest is flexible, but I'm thinking M21/WM7/COT12 in a STR build (yes, has a disadvantage with small stature) - Monk/Wiz/XXX or
Monk/Cleric/XXX are defensible choices, too. Even Monk/Paladin/XXX

Melee preference - two-hands a katana or scimitar for his STR bonus (katana should've been a two-hander all along)

Range preference - DEX archery

Weapon preference - katana or scimitar - orginally thought katana, but that burns an extra feat and one can legitimately make a case for scimitar as a "saber"

8) Maximum item enhancement - +5 environment

9) Spellcasting - I'd assume primarily a buffer

10) Custom factors - none,  but would like BAB of 40+

Thanks!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I know, but since you are gonna level this one by playing in modules you will want it to mature early so you will actually "play" Yoda at some point and not simply have him ready when the game ends Fist,

The obvious choice if you don't want to have any XP penalty is to replace Fighter for CoT, say Monk 12/ CoT 4/ Wm 4 pre-epic and then finish as Monk 25/ CoT 8/ Wm 7 but you will loose 1 AB due to CoT requirements (AB +7) that will force you to take Monk 12 pre-epic instead of Monk 8. Moreover you will not want to lose +6 dmg/hit especially when it is multiplied by Wm criticals. You already lose some power due to race (lower strength) you see. But anyway if you don't want XP penalties then Monk 25/ CoT 8/ Wm 7 is what i recommend, with Monk 12/ CoT 4/ Wm 4 pre-epic, that will give you the exact amount of feats required to make the build and will postpone your Wm powers to 23rd level but that's what i would do. Going Wm wiithout either Fighter OR CoT is a pain, especially if you consider you aren't a Human for the bonus feat.

That being said, if you haven't played yet a Monk/Wm then absolutely do it, it's a blast to rush through your opponents with the speed of the Monk, it really briings the smile on your face!

Lest we forget, Yoda was also a swordmaster - according to Wookieepedia:

"Yoda was one of the most renowned and powerful Jedi Masters in galactic history. He was known for his legendary wisdom, mastery of the Force and skills in lightsaber combat. Yoda served as a member of the Jedi High Council in the last centuries of the Galactic Republic and as Grand Master oversaw the Jedi Order before, during and after the devastating Clone Wars. Following the First Battle of Geonosis, Yoda held the title of Master of the Order in addition to that of Grand Master. In his centuries of service to the galaxy and the Force, Grand Master Yoda had a hand in the training of nearly all the Jedi in the Order, including such luminaries as Obi-Wan Kenobi, Ki-Adi-Mundi and Oppo Rancisis; all of whom would come to serve on the Jedi Council along with him. Standing at about 66 cm tall, Yoda was a male member of a mysterious species, details of which he did not reveal. Yoda served as a member of the Jedi Order for centuries, eventually gaining a seat on the Jedi High Council, before reigning as the Grand Master of the Jedi. He had exceptional skills in lightsaber combat, most commonly employing whirling and acrobatic Form IV techniques. Yoda was a But master of all but the Vaapad subset of Form VII (he had mastered the original Form VII variant known as Juyo) of lightsaber combat, and was considered by many as a swordmaster. "

So high wisdom, mastery of the Force and a skilled lightsaber combatant - Cleric/Something/Warrior?  Or will Divine Power make him Warrior enough?  I can see Maximillan Kane's Shadow Priest single wielding a kama . . . but AB unbuffed is kinda low and all damage comes from buffs.  If we had Intuitive Attack to work with . . .

A high Wis cleric spamming Hammer of the Gods and wading in with lightkama to finish them off . . . If undispellability is not crucial . . . CL17/COT12/M11?  Improved Evasion, Immune to poison, non-magical disease, 9th level spells (at a low DC), great saves . . .  

I still think I'm missing something that is right in front of my nose . . .

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Excellent build, although your calculations seem a bit off.

Your armour class should be (35) in robes and your attack bonus a very solid (45) - (Hin's get +1AB/ +1AC/ +1 to all Saves).

I would throw-out toughness and take both blind-fight and improved critical: kama, you have more than enough hit points for an epic dodging character. I would also work Taunt in your skill list in place of another skill. And max-out your stealth skills, that's important except if everybody has true sight in those modules. Forget blinding speed, it is one of the worst possible feats in NwN 1.


* Seriously though, Yoda a Cleric? And a Shadow Dancer too?! Wielding a farm implement?! That's a Catholic Ninja!
Oh wait... he is a Paladin not a Cleric, that's something at least

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
For playability, I'd take Paladin at level 1 so I could take Weapon Finesse right away for a +5 AB (with DEX 10 points higher than STR), and then take WF at level 3 and Blind Fight at level 6. Also, take Tougness at 12, Improved Crit at 15, and Mobility at 18. Since you will have a good Tumble, the only reason to take Mobility is to qualify for SD. As a minor tweak, take EWF at 30 instead of 33 to minimize the number of levels at which the DEX is an odd number.
If Haste is not available by other means, then Blinding Speed would be nice, but you can take it on a Paladin level, so you woudln't have to swap when you take what class.
